sub_title: Industrial Operations Trainee at Bunge | TU Delft | Chemical Engineering | Transport Phenomena
summary:
Hi! I am Medhavi, a second-year MSc Chemical Engineering student at TU Delft, the Netherlands. I have received Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering (Gold Medalist) from Pandit Deendayal Petroleum University, India. My areas of interest include process control and optimization, transport phenomena, hydrogen technology, and process and product design. 

During my master thesis project, I developed an algorithm which can make continuous 'visualisation' of the ongoing phenomena in a process vessel. Such an algorithm can be used for real-time analysis or as post-processing technique for better optimization and process control. This work is elaborated in my thesis is titled, 'An Integral Approach for Field Reconstruction based on the Helmholtz-Hodge Decomposition: A Proof of Concept for Discrete Data obtained using Flow-Following Temperature Sensors'. 

Alongside academics, I have assisted for two master-level courses, 'Advanced Thermodynamics' and 'Molecular Transport Phenomena. For Advanced Thermodynamics, I help students with their Aspen Plus-based assignments. For Molecular Transport Phenomena, I assisted the professor in renewing the content of the course. Besides as community officer, I acted as a mentor to a group of ten first-year master's students and helped them with their academic and personal problems. Apart from these roles, I held the treasury of the Faculty Student Council - Applied Sciences for the year 2022-23 and took charge as Secretary OV. These varied responsibilities have facilitated the development of a good team spirit along with professional skills which have helped me in getting a chance to communicate well with people from different walks of life.

contributors.headline: Industrial Operations Trainee at Bunge | TU Delft | Chemical Engineering | Transport Phenomena

projects.title: An Integral Approach for Field Re-construction based on the Helmholtz-Hodge Decomposition: A Proof of Concept for Discrete Data obtained using Flow-Following Temperature Sensors.
projects.description: The project is embedded in ongoing research in the Transport Phenomena group on the development of a general framework, using global mathematical constraints and physical laws, for the reconstruction of the fields inside a process from measurements with wireless flow-following sensors. The project is an extension of a previous M.Sc. thesis in which, as a proof of concept, these ideas were applied to a simple steady-state heat conduction process, by including heat sources and/or flow in the (steady and/or unsteady) process. The ideas are explored conceptually and, also, concretely using numerical simulations.

projects.title: Role of Computational Fluid Dynamics in Analysis and Design of Chemical Reactors
projects.description: Chemical reactors are considered as the life-line of every chemical process industry. The design of novel reactors and the detailed analysis of these new as well as existing models is of paramount importance for their efficient utilization. Modeling and simulation are essential tools in design and scale-up of the reactors, and as the performance requirements are growing, it is needed that any proposed reactor model would be able to define not only spatial distribution of involved species but also temperature and velocity profiles within the reactor. The main limitation in the ordinary models is the poor knowledge of flow and thermal patterns within the reactors. Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) has proven to be a reliable tool for modeling and simulating flow and heat transfer phenomena while designing a process equipment. In this work, we have analysed the role of CFD as a powerful tool to produce predictions for the flow and thermal behaviour in complex reactor designs based on the numerical resolution of the conservation equations of mass, momentum, and energy. The validated models may be then used to investigate flow characteristics like temperature, pressure and flow rates of the reactants and products. The results can, in turn, be used to evaluate the performance and limitations of different reactor designs.

profile_positions.description:
FSC-TNW consists of 8-9 students from the Faculty of Applied Sciences, each representing the values and needs of students from their study programme on a faculty level. FSC acts as a partner to the faculty management and has regular meetings with them to improve on education, research, facilities, and legislation. 
As Secretary OV (overlegvergadering), I am responsible for making the minutes of our OV meetings with the Dean and faculty board. While as Treasurer, I keep a close eye on the annual faculty budget and give advice and also suggestions if required.
profile_positions.title: Secretary OV and Treasurer of Faculty Student Council TNW

profile_positions.description: Helped professors conduct a master-level course 'Advanced Thermodynamics'. I assist students with their queries during tutorial (working class) hours, get the necessary information from Aspen Plus for their assignments, and grade their assignments and exams.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: As a student assistant to Prof. Valeria Garbin and Prof. Pouyan Boukany for a master-level course ' CH3153 Molecular Transport Phenomena', I assisted with the content development of the course, which included tutorials for lecture slides, assignment questions for working classes, and exams.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• A part of the "Phenomenal Team" as a teaching assistant to aid the professors (Prof. Bijoy Bera and Prof. Valeria Garbin) with a Bachelor’s course " 4052FYSTRY Physical Transport Phenomena (Fysische Transportverschijnselen FTV)", offered by TU Delft and Leiden University in collaboration.
• Offering assistance to professors to conduct the course, grading assignments and the final examination. Help 90+ students with their questions during tutorial hours.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: Worked in a team of six members on a project titled ''Sugar Reduction in Malt-based Beverages" in collaboration with Heineken, a leading Dutch beer company. I was responsible for the heat and mass balances, developing the process flow diagram, and the process control aspect of the project.
profile_positions.title: Conceptual Design Project

profile_positions.description:
A stipendiary research internship, as a part of my BTech final semester, under the Industrial Research and Consultancy Centre (IRCC) and Department of Chemical Engineering, IIT Bombay, for a period of six months (January-June 2020).

Project Title: A CFD Study on Spouted Bed.
•	Developed a pseudo-two-dimensional system to examine the characteristics of a spouted bed. 
•	Implemented the Two-Fluid Modeling (TFM) approach to simulate predictions for gas and solid phase dynamics and temperature distribution inside the bed, using ANSYS Fluent. 
•	Conducted a sensitivity analysis to assess the influence of the characteristic parameters on the solution.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
•	Co-ordinated and organized Chem-O-Philia, India’s Largest Intercollegiate Chemical Engineering Quiz Competition, at PDPU campus with a total of 40 teams participating on the event day.
•	Point of Contact: Bridging the gap between PDPU participants, authorities, and Team AZeotropy by providing an exchange of queries, information, and support.
•	Spreading Awareness: Built a network across students to publicize, promote, and share the latest AZeotropy events and activities.
profile_positions.title: Campus Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
•The training included the basics fundamental concepts of Line Sizing and Pipe Hydraulics, development stages of Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs) and Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams(PIDs), HAZOP, Pre-commissioning, and Commissioning.
•	Assisted in the development and assessment of PFDs and P&ID, specifically associated with Low Pressure and Medium Pressure Wet Air Oxidation projects.
•	Consecutively checked and upgraded the PFDs, P&IDS, and Mechanical Data Sheets before the approval stage.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

profile_positions.description:
•	Taught Algebra and Geometry courses to underprivileged 8th graders living in the locality of Warshiya, Vadodara.
•	Promoted SV Mission’s vocational course offerings in the households of Warshiya.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: As a community officer, I mentored a group of ten first-year master's students. I coached these new master students with their academic, personal, or general issues; guiding them towards a smooth transition into TU Delft life.

The main aim of the training was to develop the quality of character, courage, comradeship, discipline, secular outlook, the spirit of adventure, sportsmanship, and ideals of selfless service. 
•	Acted as a pilot for 72nd Independence Day and 70th Republic Day university parades.
•	Drill instructor to 20+ junior cadets. 
•	Awarded ‘first grade’ in 10m air rifle training. 
•	Qualified NCC B and C-Certificate Examinations.
•	Undertook a training on “Disaster Relief Training for NCC Cadets” held at the Gujarat Institute of Disaster Management (GIDM), Gandhinagar from 17th-19th July 2017.
